result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel F Greene was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $25.00 per month commencing 10/15/2016 with payment plan fee of $15.00. Alternate 16 days jail.
DNA paid along with fine on payment plan.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joel F Greene

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order for reimbursement of GAL or Attorney

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Thomas K. Voss.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Joel F Greene in court with attorney Thomas K. Voss.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 1.  Count 2 is dismissed and read-in.  Court finds the defendant guilty.  Court sentences the defendant to the following:

Count 1:

Fine - $694.00
DNA Surcharge - $200.00 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid at the rate of $25.00/month commencing October 15, 2016 or alternate 16 days jail.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 16, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Joel F Greene in court with attorney Thomas K. Voss.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests adjournment for the status of his client's treatment.  Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2016 at 09:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.

Defendant Joel F Greene in court with attorney Thomas K. Voss.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment. Court grants. Discovery provided to the defense.  Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2016 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joel F Greene in court.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant was found eligible for the pubilc defender. Defendant is requesting the court to appoint counsel. Court grants and the defendant is to reimburse the county at the rate of $50.00 a month commencing 05/15/2016 and every month thereafter. Court adjourns for the status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for June 6, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Joel F Greene in court.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant would like to represent himself, but court does adjourn the matter for the defendant to go to the public defender's office.  Hearing scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Joel F Greene in court.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant did not go to the public defender's office and would like to represent himself. Defendant is currently in a dirver's safety plan and would like to accept the state's offer. Defendant needs time to complete the program. Court adjourns the matter.  Hearing scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Joel F Greene in court.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 10:30 am.
